slides.title: Welcome to ACCA LW
slides.content:
# Corporate and Business Law (LW)

LW covers the **legal framework** for business operations.

## What You Will Learn

- **Legal Systems** - Sources of law
- **Contract Law** - Formation and breach
- **Employment Law** - Rights and obligations
- **Company Law** - Formation and governance

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Legal system | 10% |
| Contract law | 25% |
| Employment law | 15% |
| Company law | 40% |
| Insolvency | 10% |

slides.title: Sources of Law
slides.content:
# Legal Systems

## Sources of Law

| Source | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Legislation | Acts of Parliament |
| Common law | Judge-made law |
| EU law | European regulations |
| Custom | Established practices |

## Court Hierarchy (UK)

```
Supreme Court (highest)
    |
    v
Court of Appeal
    |
    v
High Court
    |
    v
County Courts / Magistrates
```

## Civil vs Criminal

| Civil | Criminal |
|-------|----------|
| Private disputes | State vs individual |
| Compensation | Punishment |
| Balance of probabilities | Beyond reasonable doubt |

slides.title: Contract Formation
slides.content:
# Elements of a Contract

## Essential Elements

| Element | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Offer | Clear proposal |
| Acceptance | Unqualified agreement |
| Consideration | Value exchanged |
| Intention | Legal relations intended |
| Capacity | Legal ability |

## Offer vs Invitation to Treat

| Offer | Invitation to Treat |
|-------|---------------------|
| Can be accepted | Invites offers |
| Creates contract | No contract yet |
| Specific terms | General display |

## Termination of Offer

- Revocation
- Rejection
- Counter-offer
- Lapse of time
- Death

slides.title: Contract Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: A shop window display is generally considered?

slides.title: Contract Terms
slides.content:
# Contract Terms

## Types of Terms

| Type | Breach Effect |
|------|---------------|
| Condition | Terminate + damages |
| Warranty | Damages only |
| Innominate | Depends on breach |

## Implied Terms

- By statute (Sale of Goods Act)
- By custom
- By courts

## Exemption Clauses

| Rule | Effect |
|------|--------|
| Incorporation | Must be part of contract |
| Construction | Interpreted narrowly |
| Legislation | UCTA restrictions |

slides.title: Breach and Remedies
slides.content:
# Breach of Contract

## Types of Breach

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Actual | Party fails to perform |
| Anticipatory | Party indicates non-performance |

## Remedies

| Remedy | Purpose |
|--------|--------|
| Damages | Monetary compensation |
| Specific performance | Force performance |
| Injunction | Prevent action |
| Rescission | Undo contract |

## Damages Calculation

```
Expectation loss:
Put party in position as if contract performed

Reliance loss:
Recover expenses incurred
```

slides.title: Employment Law
slides.content:
# Employment Relationship

## Employee vs Contractor

| Employee | Contractor |
|----------|------------|
| Control by employer | Independent |
| Integration | Own business |
| Tax/NI deducted | Self-employed |

## Employment Contract

| Term | Requirement |
|------|------------|
| Job title | Written |
| Pay | Written |
| Hours | Written |
| Notice | Statutory minimum |

## Termination

- Resignation
- Dismissal
- Redundancy
- Expiry of fixed term

slides.title: Unfair Dismissal
slides.content:
# Dismissal Rights

## Fair Reasons

| Reason | Example |
|--------|--------|
| Capability | Poor performance |
| Conduct | Misconduct |
| Redundancy | Job no longer exists |
| Statutory | Legal prohibition |
| SOSR | Other substantial reason |

## Unfair Dismissal

| Requirement | Details |
|-------------|--------|
| Qualifying period | 2 years |
| Procedural fairness | Proper process |
| Reasonable decision | Employer's belief |

## Automatically Unfair

- Pregnancy
- Trade union membership
- Whistleblowing
- Health and safety

slides.title: Employment Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the general qualifying period for unfair dismissal claims?

slides.title: Company Formation
slides.content:
# Forming a Company

## Registration Documents

| Document | Contents |
|----------|----------|
| Memorandum | Subscriber intentions |
| Articles | Internal rules |
| Form IN01 | Application details |

## Companies House

- Registrar of companies
- Issues certificate of incorporation
- Maintains public records

## Legal Personality

```
Salomon v Salomon (1897):
- Company is separate legal person
- Distinct from shareholders
- Can own property, sue, be sued
```

slides.title: Company Constitution
slides.content:
# Articles of Association

## Model Articles

Default rules if none adopted:
- Management by directors
- Share transfer provisions
- Meeting procedures

## Amendment

| Requirement | Details |
|-------------|--------|
| Special resolution | 75% majority |
| Registration | File with Companies House |

## Binding Effect

- Contract between company and members
- Contract between members
- Not third parties

slides.title: Share Capital
slides.content:
# Shares and Capital

## Types of Shares

| Type | Rights |
|------|--------|
| Ordinary | Voting, dividends |
| Preference | Fixed dividend priority |
| Redeemable | Can be bought back |

## Share Capital Terms

| Term | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Authorized | Maximum allowed |
| Issued | Actually issued |
| Paid-up | Amount received |
| Called-up | Amount demanded |

## Capital Maintenance

- Cannot reduce without court/procedure
- Dividends only from profits
- Cannot purchase own shares (generally)

slides.title: Directors Duties
slides.content:
# Directors

## Statutory Duties (CA 2006)

| Duty | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Act within powers | Follow constitution |
| Promote success | Benefit members |
| Independent judgment | Own decision |
| Skill and care | Competent performance |
| Avoid conflicts | No competing interests |
| No third-party benefits | No secret profits |
| Declare interests | Transparency |

## Breach Consequences

- Account for profits
- Damages
- Restoration of property
- Disqualification

slides.title: Directors Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Directors must promote the success of the company for the benefit of?

slides.title: Company Meetings
slides.content:
# Shareholder Meetings

## Types

| Meeting | Purpose |
|---------|--------|
| AGM | Annual matters |
| GM | Other business |

## Resolutions

| Type | Majority | Uses |
|------|----------|------|
| Ordinary | 50%+ | General matters |
| Special | 75%+ | Constitution changes |

## Voting

| Method | Basis |
|--------|-------|
| Show of hands | One vote per person |
| Poll | Votes by shareholding |

## Notice Requirements

- AGM: 21 days (public)
- GM: 14 days
- Can be waived

slides.title: Insolvency
slides.content:
# Corporate Insolvency

## Insolvency Tests

| Test | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Cash flow | Cannot pay debts as due |
| Balance sheet | Liabilities exceed assets |

## Insolvency Procedures

| Procedure | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| Administration | Rescue company |
| Liquidation | Wind up company |
| CVA | Arrangement with creditors |

## Order of Payment

1. Fixed charge holders
2. Preferential creditors
3. Floating charge holders
4. Unsecured creditors
5. Shareholders

slides.title: Fraudulent/Wrongful Trading
slides.content:
# Director Liability

## Fraudulent Trading

| Element | Requirement |
|---------|------------|
| Intent | Defraud creditors |
| Liability | Civil and criminal |
| Standard | Actual dishonesty |

## Wrongful Trading

| Element | Requirement |
|---------|------------|
| Knowledge | Knew insolvency inevitable |
| Failure | Did not minimize loss |
| Liability | Civil only |

## Defense

- Took every step to minimize loss
- Reasonably believed recovery possible

## Consequences

- Personal contribution to assets
- Disqualification
